pli-tv-pvr16:0.3.eng: 1. Participated in the robe-making ceremony, etc.
pli-tv-pvr16:0.3.comm: For a discussion of the word kathina, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-pvr16:1.1.eng: Who has not participated in the robe-making ceremony?

pli-tv-pvr16:1.2.eng: Who has participated in the robe-making ceremony?

pli-tv-pvr16:1.3.eng: How has the robe-making ceremony not been performed?

pli-tv-pvr16:1.4.eng: How has the robe-making ceremony been performed?

pli-tv-pvr16:2.1.eng: Who has not participated in the robe-making ceremony?

pli-tv-pvr16:2.3.eng: those who have not performed the robe-making ceremony and those who have not expressed their appreciation.
pli-tv-pvr16:2.3.comm: The performer of the ceremony is the person who receives the specially made kathina robe. The other participants are those who take part in the legal procedure and then express their appreciation.

pli-tv-pvr16:2.4.pli: Imesaṃ dvinnaṃ puggalānaṃ anatthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr16:3.1.eng: Who has participated the robe-making ceremony?

pli-tv-pvr16:3.3.eng: those who have performed the robe-making ceremony and those who have expressed their appreciation.

pli-tv-pvr16:3.4.pli: Imesaṃ dvinnaṃ puggalānaṃ atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr16:4.1.eng: How has the robe-making ceremony not been performed?

pli-tv-pvr16:4.2.eng: There are twenty-four ways in which the robe-making ceremony has not been performed:
pli-tv-pvr16:4.2.comm: For a further explanation of these twenty-four, see Kd 7:1.5.3–1.5.26.

pli-tv-pvr16:4.3.eng: The robe-making ceremony has not been performed merely by marking the cloth,

pli-tv-pvr16:4.9.eng: merely by marking with a strip of cloth,

pli-tv-pvr16:4.11.eng: merely by adding a border lengthwise,

pli-tv-pvr16:4.12.eng: merely by adding a border crosswise,

pli-tv-pvr16:4.15.eng: nor has it been performed if a monk has made an indication,

pli-tv-pvr16:4.16.eng: if a monk has given a hint,

pli-tv-pvr16:4.17.eng: if the robe-cloth has been borrowed,
pli-tv-pvr16:4.17.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “robe-cloth” for cīvara, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-pvr16:4.19.eng: if it is to be relinquished,

pli-tv-pvr16:4.20.eng: if it has not been marked,

pli-tv-pvr16:4.21.pli: na aññatra saṅghāṭiyā atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ,
pli-tv-pvr16:4.21.eng: if it is not an outer robe

pli-tv-pvr16:4.22.pli: na aññatra uttarāsaṅgena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ,

pli-tv-pvr16:4.23.pli: na aññatra antaravāsakena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ,

pli-tv-pvr16:4.24.pli: na aññatra pañcakena vā atirekapañcakena vā tadaheva sañchinnena samaṇḍalīkatena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ,
pli-tv-pvr16:4.24.eng: nor has it been performed if the robe has not been made on that very day with five or more cut sections with panels,

pli-tv-pvr16:4.25.pli: na aññatra puggalassa atthārā atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ,
pli-tv-pvr16:4.25.eng: if the robe-making ceremony was not performed by an individual,

pli-tv-pvr16:4.26.pli: sammā ce atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, tañce nissīmaṭṭho anumodati.
pli-tv-pvr16:4.26.eng: or if the robe-making ceremony has been performed correctly but the appreciation for the ceremony was expressed outside the monastery zone.
pli-tv-pvr16:4.26.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “monastery zone” for sīmā, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-pvr16:5.1.eng: Making an indication: one makes an indication, thinking,

pli-tv-pvr16:5.2.eng: “I’ll perform the robe-making ceremony with this cloth.”

pli-tv-pvr16:5.3.eng: Hinting: one gives a hint, thinking,

pli-tv-pvr16:5.4.eng: “With this hint, I’ll make a cloth for the robe-making ceremony appear.”

pli-tv-pvr16:5.5.eng: Borrowed: a gift not to be taken as one’s own is so called.

pli-tv-pvr16:5.6.eng: Stored: there are two kinds of storing:

pli-tv-pvr16:5.7.eng: storing for the purpose of making and storing for the purpose of accumulation.

pli-tv-pvr16:5.8.eng: To be relinquished: dawn arrives while it is being made.

pli-tv-pvr16:5.9.pli: Imehi catuvīsatiyā ākārehi anatthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr16:6.1.eng: How has the robe-making ceremony been performed?

pli-tv-pvr16:6.2.eng: The robe-making ceremony has been performed through seventeen aspects:

pli-tv-pvr16:6.3.pli: Ahatena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, ahatakappena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, pilotikāya atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, paṃsukūlena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, pāpaṇikena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, animittakatena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, aparikathākatena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, akukkukatena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, asannidhikatena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, anissaggiyena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, kappakatena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, saṅghāṭiyā atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, uttarāsaṅgena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, antaravāsakena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, pañcakena vā atirekapañcakena vā tadaheva sañchinnena samaṇḍalīkatena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, puggalassa atthārā atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, sammā ce atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, tañce sīmaṭṭho anumodati, evampi atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr16:6.3.eng: The robe-making ceremony has been performed if the cloth is brand new, if it is nearly new, if it is old, if it is a rag, if it is from a shop; it has been performed if a monk has not made an indication, if a monk has not given a hint, if the robe-cloth has not been borrowed, if it has not been stored, if it is not to be relinquished, if it has been marked, if it is an outer robe or an upper robe or a sarong; it has been performed if the robe has been made on that very day with five or more cut sections with panels, if the robe-making ceremony was performed by an individual, if the robe-making ceremony has been performed correctly and if the appreciation for the ceremony was expressed inside the monastery zone.

pli-tv-pvr16:6.4.pli: Imehi sattarasahi ākārehi atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr16:7.1.pli: Saha kathinassa atthārā kati dhammā jāyanti?
pli-tv-pvr16:7.1.eng: How many things are produced together with the participation in the robe-making ceremony?

pli-tv-pvr16:7.2.pli: Saha kathinassa atthārā pannarasa dhammā jāyanti—

pli-tv-pvr16:7.3.eng: eight key phrases, two obstacles, and five benefits.

pli-tv-pvr16:7.4.pli: Saha kathinassa atthārā ime pannarasa dhammā jāyanti.

pli-tv-pvr16:8.0.eng: 2. The proximity condition for the robe-making ceremony, etc.

pli-tv-pvr16:8.1.pli: Payogassa katame dhammā anantarapaccayena paccayo, samanantarapaccayena paccayo, nissayapaccayena paccayo, upanissayapaccayena paccayo, purejātapaccayena paccayo, pacchājātapaccayena paccayo, sahajātapaccayena paccayo?
pli-tv-pvr16:8.1.eng: Which things are a condition for effort by being a proximity condition, an immediacy condition, a support condition, a decisive support condition, a pre-arising condition, a post-arising condition, and a co-arising condition?
pli-tv-pvr16:8.1.comm: Sp 5.404: Payogassāti cīvaradhovanādino sattavidhassa pubbakaraṇassatthāya yo udakāharaṇādiko payogo kayirati, tassa payogassa, “For effort: the effort of fetching water, etc., is done for the sake of the seven-fold prior action, beginning with washing the robe—for that effort.” Here we see the introduction of the Abhidhamma terminology of conditionality.

pli-tv-pvr16:8.2.eng: Which things are a condition for the prior duties by being a proximity condition …

pli-tv-pvr16:8.3.eng: Which things are a condition for relinquishment …
pli-tv-pvr16:8.3.comm: Sp 5.404: Paccuddhārassāti purāṇasaṅghāṭiādīnaṁ paccuddharaṇassa, “Relinquishment: relinquishment of the old outer robe, etc.”

pli-tv-pvr16:8.4.eng: Which things are a condition for determining …
pli-tv-pvr16:8.4.comm: Sp 5.404: Adhiṭṭhānassāti kathinacīvarādhiṭṭhānassa, “Determining: determining of the robe of the robe-making ceremony.”

pli-tv-pvr16:8.5.eng: Which things are a condition for participating in the robe-making ceremony …

pli-tv-pvr16:8.6.eng: Which things are a condition for the key phrases and the obstacles …

pli-tv-pvr16:8.7.pli: vatthussa katame dhammā anantarapaccayena paccayo, samanantarapaccayena paccayo, nissayapaccayena paccayo, upanissayapaccayena paccayo, purejātapaccayena paccayo, pacchājātapaccayena paccayo, sahajātapaccayena paccayo?
pli-tv-pvr16:8.7.eng: Which things are a condition for the object by being a proximity condition, an immediacy condition, a support condition, a decisive support condition, a pre-arising condition, a post-arising condition, and a co-arising condition?
pli-tv-pvr16:8.7.comm: Sp 5.404: Vatthussāti saṅghāṭiādino kathinavatthussa, “Object: the object of the robe-making ceremony, which is the outer robe, etc.”

pli-tv-pvr16:9.1.pli: Pubbakaraṇaṃ payogassa anantarapaccayena paccayo, samanantarapaccayena paccayo, nissayapaccayena paccayo, upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
pli-tv-pvr16:9.1.eng: The prior duties are a condition for effort by being a proximity condition, an immediacy condition, a support condition, and a decisive support condition.
pli-tv-pvr16:9.1.comm: Sp 5.404: Yasmā tena payogena nipphādetabbassa pubbakaraṇassatthāya so payogo kayirati, tasmā imehi catūhi paccayehi paccayo hoti, “Because that effort is done for the purpose of the preliminary actions, which are to be produced by that effort, therefore it is the condition by way of these four conditions.” It is curious that the prior duties are said to be conditions for effort when in fact the effort is done first and the outcome is the prior duties. The commentary explains this strange state of affairs as follows. Sp 5.404: Katame dhammā anantarapaccayena paccayoti anāgatavasena anantarā hutvā katame dhammā paccayā hontīti attho, “Which things are a condition as a proximity condition: which things are conditions of proximity by way of the future? This is the meaning.” In this way the ordinary conditioning relationship is inverted, that is, the condition is temporarily later than the outcome. We see the same pattern below. My sincere thanks go to Ven. Bhikkhu Bodhi for helping me untangle the ideas in this section.

pli-tv-pvr16:9.2.eng: Effort is a condition for the prior duties by being a pre-arising condition.

pli-tv-pvr16:9.3.eng: The prior duties are a condition for effort by being a post-arising condition.

pli-tv-pvr16:9.4.eng: The fifteen things are a condition by being a co-arising condition.

pli-tv-pvr16:9.5.pli: Paccuddhāro pubbakaraṇassa anantarapaccayena paccayo, samanantarapaccayena paccayo, nissayapaccayena paccayo, upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
pli-tv-pvr16:9.5.eng: Relinquishment is a condition for the prior duties by being a proximity condition, an immediacy condition, a support condition, and a decisive support condition.

pli-tv-pvr16:9.6.eng: The prior duties are a condition for relinquishment by being a pre-arising condition.

pli-tv-pvr16:9.7.eng: Relinquishment is a condition for the prior duties by being a post-arising condition.

pli-tv-pvr16:9.8.eng: The fifteen things are a condition by being a co-arising condition.

pli-tv-pvr16:9.9.pli: Adhiṭṭhānaṃ paccuddhārassa anantarapaccayena paccayo, samanantarapaccayena paccayo, nissayapaccayena paccayo, upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
pli-tv-pvr16:9.9.eng: Determining is a condition for relinquishment by being a proximity condition, an immediacy condition, a support condition, and a decisive support condition.

pli-tv-pvr16:9.10.eng: Relinquishment is a condition for determining by being a pre-arising condition.

pli-tv-pvr16:9.11.eng: Determining is a condition for relinquishment by being a post-arising condition.

pli-tv-pvr16:9.12.eng: The fifteen things are a condition by being a co-arising condition.

pli-tv-pvr16:9.13.pli: Atthāro adhiṭṭhānassa anantarapaccayena paccayo, samanantarapaccayena paccayo, nissayapaccayena paccayo, upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
pli-tv-pvr16:9.13.eng: Performing the robe-making ceremony is a condition for determining by being a proximity condition, an immediacy condition, a support condition, and a decisive support condition.

pli-tv-pvr16:9.14.eng: Determining is a condition for performing the robe-making ceremony by being a pre-arising condition.

pli-tv-pvr16:9.15.eng: Performing the robe-making ceremony is a condition for determining by being a post-arising condition.

pli-tv-pvr16:9.16.eng: The fifteen things are a condition by being a co-arising condition.

pli-tv-pvr16:9.17.pli: Mātikā ca palibodhā ca atthārassa anantarapaccayena paccayo, samanantarapaccayena paccayo, nissayapaccayena paccayo, upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
pli-tv-pvr16:9.17.eng: The key phrases and the obstacles are a condition for performing the robe-making ceremony by being a proximity condition, an immediacy condition, a support condition, and a decisive support condition.

pli-tv-pvr16:9.18.eng: Performing the robe-making ceremony is a condition for the key phrases and the obstacles by being a pre-arising condition.

pli-tv-pvr16:9.19.pli: Mātikā ca palibodhā ca atthārassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo.
pli-tv-pvr16:9.19.eng: The key phrases and the obstacles are a condition for performing the robe-making ceremony by being a post-arising condition.

pli-tv-pvr16:9.20.eng: The fifteen things are a condition by being a co-arising condition.

pli-tv-pvr16:9.21.pli: Āsā ca anāsā ca vatthussa anantarapaccayena paccayo, samanantarapaccayena paccayo, nissayapaccayena paccayo, upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
pli-tv-pvr16:9.21.eng: Expectation and non-expectation are a condition for the object by being a proximity condition, an immediacy condition, a support condition, and a decisive support condition.

pli-tv-pvr16:9.22.eng: The object is a condition for expectation and non-expectation by being a pre-arising condition.

pli-tv-pvr16:9.23.pli: Āsā ca anāsā ca vatthussa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo.
pli-tv-pvr16:9.23.eng: Expectation and non-expectation are a condition for the object by being a post-arising condition.

pli-tv-pvr16:9.24.eng: The fifteen things are a condition by being a co-arising condition.

pli-tv-pvr16:10.0.eng: 3. The details on the source of the prior duties, etc.

pli-tv-pvr16:10.1.pli: Pubbakaraṇaṃ kiṃnidānaṃ, kiṃsamudayaṃ, kiṃjātikaṃ, kiṃpabhavaṃ, kiṃsambhāraṃ, kiṃsamuṭṭhānaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr16:10.1.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of the prior duties?

pli-tv-pvr16:10.2.pli: Paccuddhāro kiṃnidāno, kiṃsamudayo, kiṃjātiko, kiṃpabhavo, kiṃsambhāro, kiṃsamuṭṭhāno?
pli-tv-pvr16:10.2.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of relinquishment?

pli-tv-pvr16:10.3.pli: Adhiṭṭhānaṃ kiṃnidānaṃ, kiṃsamudayaṃ, kiṃjātikaṃ, kiṃpabhavaṃ, kiṃsambhāraṃ, kiṃsamuṭṭhānaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr16:10.3.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of determining?

pli-tv-pvr16:10.4.pli: Atthāro kiṃnidāno, kiṃsamudayo, kiṃjātiko, kiṃpabhavo, kiṃsambhāro, kiṃsamuṭṭhāno?
pli-tv-pvr16:10.4.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of performing the robe-making ceremony?

pli-tv-pvr16:10.5.pli: Mātikā ca palibodhā ca kiṃnidānā, kiṃsamudayā, kiṃjātikā, kiṃpabhavā, kiṃsambhārā kiṃsamuṭṭhānā?
pli-tv-pvr16:10.5.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of the key phrases and the obstacles?

pli-tv-pvr16:10.6.pli: Āsā ca anāsā ca kiṃnidānā, kiṃsamudayā, kiṃjātikā, kiṃpabhavā, kiṃsambhārā, kiṃsamuṭṭhānā?
pli-tv-pvr16:10.6.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of expectation and non-expectation?

pli-tv-pvr16:11.1.pli: Pubbakaraṇaṃ payoganidānaṃ, payogasamudayaṃ, payogajātikaṃ, payogapabhavaṃ, payogasambhāraṃ, payogasamuṭṭhānaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr16:11.1.eng: The prior duties have effort as their source, origin, birth, arising, production, and origination.

pli-tv-pvr16:11.2.pli: Paccuddhāro pubbakaraṇanidāno, pubbakaraṇasamudayo, pubbakaraṇajātiko, pubbakaraṇapabhavo, pubbakaraṇasambhāro, pubbakaraṇasamuṭṭhāno.
pli-tv-pvr16:11.2.eng: Relinquishment has the prior duties as its source, origin, birth, arising, production, and origination.

pli-tv-pvr16:11.3.pli: Adhiṭṭhānaṃ paccuddhāranidānaṃ, paccuddhārasamudayaṃ, paccuddhārajātikaṃ, paccuddhārapabhavaṃ, paccuddhārasambhāraṃ, paccuddhārasamuṭṭhānaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr16:11.3.eng: Determining has relinquishment as its source, origin, birth, arising, production, and origination.

pli-tv-pvr16:11.4.pli: Atthāro adhiṭṭhānanidāno, adhiṭṭhānasamudayo, adhiṭṭhānajātiko, adhiṭṭhānapabhavo, adhiṭṭhānasambhāro, adhiṭṭhānasamuṭṭhāno.
pli-tv-pvr16:11.4.eng: Performing the robe-making ceremony has determining as its source, origin, birth, arising, production, and origination.

pli-tv-pvr16:11.5.pli: Mātikā ca palibodhā ca atthāranidānā, atthārasamudayā, atthārajātikā, atthārapabhavā, atthārasambhārā, atthārasamuṭṭhānā.
pli-tv-pvr16:11.5.eng: The Key Terms and the obstacles have participating in the robe-making ceremony as their source, origin, birth, arising, production, and origination.

pli-tv-pvr16:11.6.pli: Āsā ca anāsā ca vatthunidānā, vatthusamudayā, vatthujātikā, vatthupabhavā, vatthusambhārā, vatthusamuṭṭhānā.
pli-tv-pvr16:11.6.eng: Expectation and non-expectation have the key phrases and the obstacles as their source, origin, birth, arising, production, and origination.

pli-tv-pvr16:12.1.pli: Payogo kiṃnidāno, kiṃsamudayo, kiṃjātiko, kiṃpabhavo, kiṃsambhāro, kiṃsamuṭṭhāno,
pli-tv-pvr16:12.1.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of effort?

pli-tv-pvr16:12.6.eng: … of the key phrases and the obstacles?

pli-tv-pvr16:12.8.pli: āsā ca anāsā ca kiṃnidānā, kiṃsamudayā, kiṃjātikā, kiṃpabhavā, kiṃsambhārā, kiṃsamuṭṭhānā?
pli-tv-pvr16:12.8.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of expectation and non-expectation?

pli-tv-pvr16:13.1.pli: Payogo hetunidāno, hetusamudayo, hetujātiko, hetupabhavo, hetusambhāro, hetusamuṭṭhāno.
pli-tv-pvr16:13.1.eng: Effort has causes as its source, origin, birth, arising, production, and origination.

pli-tv-pvr16:13.6.eng: The key phrases and the obstacles …

pli-tv-pvr16:13.8.pli: āsā ca anāsā ca hetunidānā, hetusamudayā, hetujātikā, hetupabhavā, hetusambhārā, hetusamuṭṭhānā.
pli-tv-pvr16:13.8.eng: Expectation and non-expectation have causes as their source, origin, birth, arising, production, and origination.

pli-tv-pvr16:14.1.pli: Payogo kiṃnidāno, kiṃsamudayo, kiṃjātiko, kiṃpabhavo, kiṃsambhāro, kiṃsamuṭṭhāno?
pli-tv-pvr16:14.1.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of effort?

pli-tv-pvr16:14.6.eng: … of the key phrases and the obstacles?

pli-tv-pvr16:14.8.pli: āsā ca anāsā ca kiṃnidānā, kiṃsamudayā, kiṃjātikā, kiṃpabhavā, kiṃsambhārā, kiṃsamuṭṭhānā?
pli-tv-pvr16:14.8.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of expectation and non-expectation?

pli-tv-pvr16:15.1.pli: Payogo paccayanidāno, paccayasamudayo, paccayajātiko, paccayapabhavo, paccayasambhāro, paccayasamuṭṭhāno.
pli-tv-pvr16:15.1.eng: Effort has conditions as its source, origin, birth, arising, production, and origination.

pli-tv-pvr16:15.6.eng: The key phrases and the obstacles …

pli-tv-pvr16:15.8.pli: āsā ca anāsā ca paccayanidānā, paccayasamudayā, paccayajātikā, paccayapabhavā, paccayasambhārā, paccayasamuṭṭhānā.
pli-tv-pvr16:15.8.eng: Expectation and non-expectation have conditions as their source, origin, birth, arising, production, and origination.

pli-tv-pvr16:16.1.eng: How many things are grouped with the prior duties?

pli-tv-pvr16:16.3.pli: Dhovanena, vicāraṇena, chedanena, bandhanena, sibbanena, rajanena, kappakaraṇena—
pli-tv-pvr16:16.3.eng: washing, planning, cutting, tacking, sewing, dyeing, and marking.

pli-tv-pvr16:17.1.eng: How many things are grouped with relinquishment?

pli-tv-pvr16:17.3.eng: the outer robe, the upper robe, and the sarong.

pli-tv-pvr16:18.1.eng: How many things are grouped with determining?

pli-tv-pvr16:18.3.eng: the outer robe, the upper robe, and the sarong.

pli-tv-pvr16:19.1.eng: How many things are grouped with performing the robe-making ceremony?

pli-tv-pvr16:20.1.pli: Kathinassa kati mūlāni, kati vatthūni, kati bhūmiyo?
pli-tv-pvr16:20.1.eng: How many roots does the robe-making ceremony have, how many objects, and how many grounds?

pli-tv-pvr16:20.2.eng: The robe-making ceremony has one root:

pli-tv-pvr16:20.5.eng: the outer robe, the upper robe, and the sarong.

pli-tv-pvr16:20.7.pli: khomaṃ, kappāsikaṃ, koseyyaṃ, kambalaṃ, sāṇaṃ, bhaṅgaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr16:20.7.eng: linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp.

pli-tv-pvr16:21.1.pli: Kathinassa ko ādi, kiṃ majjhe, kiṃ pariyosānaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr16:21.1.eng: What is the beginning, the middle, and the end of the robe-making ceremony?

pli-tv-pvr16:21.2.pli: Kathinassa pubbakaraṇaṃ ādi, kriyā majjhe, atthāro pariyosānaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr16:21.2.eng: The prior duties are the beginning, the performing is the middle, the robe-making ceremony is the end.
pli-tv-pvr16:21.2.comm: Sp 5.408: Kiriyā majjheti paccuddhāro ceva adhiṭṭhānañca, “Kiriyā majjhe: just relinquishing and determining.”

pli-tv-pvr16:22.1.pli: Katihaṅgehi samannāgato puggalo abhabbo kathinaṃ attharituṃ?
pli-tv-pvr16:22.1.eng: What sort of person is unable to perform the robe-making ceremony?

pli-tv-pvr16:22.2.pli: Katihaṅgehi samannāgato puggalo bhabbo kathinaṃ attharituṃ?
pli-tv-pvr16:22.2.eng: What sort of person is able to perform the robe-making ceremony?

pli-tv-pvr16:22.3.pli: Aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgato puggalo abhabbo kathinaṃ attharituṃ.
pli-tv-pvr16:22.3.eng: A person who has eight qualities is unable to perform the robe-making ceremony.

pli-tv-pvr16:22.4.pli: Aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgato puggalo bhabbo kathinaṃ attharituṃ.
pli-tv-pvr16:22.4.eng: A person who has eight qualities is able to perform the robe-making ceremony.

pli-tv-pvr16:22.5.pli: Katamehi aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgato puggalo abhabbo kathinaṃ attharituṃ?
pli-tv-pvr16:22.5.eng: What are the eight qualities of a person who is unable to perform the robe-making ceremony?

pli-tv-pvr16:22.6.pli: Pubbakaraṇaṃ na jānāti, paccuddhāraṃ na jānāti, adhiṭṭhānaṃ na jānāti, atthāraṃ na jānāti, mātikaṃ na jānāti, palibodhaṃ na jānāti, uddhāraṃ na jānāti, ānisaṃsaṃ na jānāti—
pli-tv-pvr16:22.6.eng: They do not know the prior duties, relinquishment, determining, the robe-making ceremony, the key phrases, the obstacles, the ending of the robe season, or the benefits.

pli-tv-pvr16:22.7.pli: imehi aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgato puggalo abhabbo kathinaṃ attharituṃ.

pli-tv-pvr16:22.8.pli: Katamehi aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgato puggalo bhabbo kathinaṃ attharituṃ?
pli-tv-pvr16:22.8.eng: What are the eight qualities of a person who is able to perform the robe-making ceremony?

pli-tv-pvr16:22.9.pli: Pubbakaraṇaṃ jānāti, paccuddhāraṃ jānāti, adhiṭṭhānaṃ jānāti, atthāraṃ jānāti, mātikaṃ jānāti, palibodhaṃ jānāti, uddhāraṃ jānāti, ānisaṃsaṃ jānāti—
pli-tv-pvr16:22.9.eng: They know the prior duties, relinquishment, determining, the robe-making ceremony, the key phrases, the obstacles, the ending of the robe season, and the benefits.

pli-tv-pvr16:22.10.pli: imehi aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgato puggalo bhabbo kathinaṃ attharituṃ.

pli-tv-pvr16:23.1.eng: For how many kinds of people is the robe-making ceremony not effective?

pli-tv-pvr16:23.2.eng: For how many kinds of people is the robe-making ceremony effective?

pli-tv-pvr16:23.3.eng: It is not effective for three kinds of people.

pli-tv-pvr16:23.4.eng: It is effective for three kinds of people.

pli-tv-pvr16:23.5.pli: Katamesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ puggalānaṃ kathinatthārā na ruhanti?
pli-tv-pvr16:23.5.eng: For which three kinds of people is it not effective?

pli-tv-pvr16:23.6.pli: Nissīmaṭṭho anumodati, anumodento na vācaṃ bhindati, vācaṃ bhindanto na paraṃ viññāpeti—
pli-tv-pvr16:23.6.eng: For one who expresses their appreciation outside the monastery zone; for one who does not express their appreciation verbally; for one who expresses it verbally, but does not inform anyone.

pli-tv-pvr16:23.7.pli: imesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ puggalānaṃ kathinatthārā na ruhanti.

pli-tv-pvr16:23.8.eng: For which three kinds of people is it effective?

pli-tv-pvr16:23.9.pli: Sīmaṭṭho anumodati, anumodento vācaṃ bhindati, vācaṃ bhindanto paraṃ viññāpeti—
pli-tv-pvr16:23.9.eng: For one who expresses their appreciation inside the monastery zone; for one who expresses their appreciation verbally; for one who expresses it verbally and informs someone.

pli-tv-pvr16:24.1.eng: How many kinds of robe-making ceremonies are invalid?

pli-tv-pvr16:24.2.eng: How many kinds of robe-making ceremonies are valid?

pli-tv-pvr16:24.3.eng: Three kinds of robe-making ceremonies are invalid.

pli-tv-pvr16:24.4.eng: Three kinds of robe-making ceremonies are valid.

pli-tv-pvr16:24.5.eng: What are the three kinds of robe-making ceremonies that are invalid?

pli-tv-pvr16:24.6.eng: The object fails; the timing fails; the making fails.
pli-tv-pvr16:24.6.comm: Sp 5.411: Vatthuvipannaṁ hotīti akappiyadussaṁ hoti. Kālavipannaṁ nāma ajja dāyakehi dinnaṁ sve saṅgho kathinatthārakassa deti. Karaṇavipannaṁ nāma tadaheva chinditvā akataṁ, “‘The object fails’: the cloth is unallowable. ‘The timing fails’: today it is given by the donors; tomorrow the Sangha gives to the one who is doing the robe-making ceremony. ‘The making fails’: they cut it, but do not finish it on the same day.”

pli-tv-pvr16:24.8.eng: What are the three kinds of robe-making ceremonies that are valid?

pli-tv-pvr16:24.9.eng: The object succeeds; the timing succeeds; the making succeeds.

pli-tv-pvr16:25.0.eng: 4. The details on what is to be known about the robe-making ceremony, etc.

pli-tv-pvr16:25.1.pli: Kathinaṃ jānitabbaṃ, kathinatthāro jānitabbo, kathinassa atthāramāso jānitabbo, kathinassa atthāravipatti jānitabbā, kathinassa atthārasampatti jānitabbā, nimittakammaṃ jānitabbaṃ, parikathā jānitabbā, kukkukataṃ jānitabbaṃ, sannidhi jānitabbā, nissaggiyaṃ jānitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr16:25.1.eng: The robe-making ceremony is to be known. Participation in the robe-making ceremony is to be known. The month of the robe-making ceremony is to be known. Failure of the robe-making ceremony is to be known. Success of the robe-making ceremony is to be known. The giving of an indication is to be known. A hint is to be known. Borrowing is to be known. Storing is to be known. Relinquishment is to be known.

pli-tv-pvr16:26.1.eng: The robe-making ceremony is to be known:

pli-tv-pvr16:26.2.pli: tesaññeva dhammānaṃ saṅgaho samavāyo nāmaṃ nāmakammaṃ nāmadheyyaṃ nirutti byañjanaṃ abhilāpo yadidaṃ kathinanti.
pli-tv-pvr16:26.2.eng: “the robe-making ceremony” is the grouping and coming together of just those things—their name, appellation, label, terminology, wording, designation.
pli-tv-pvr16:26.2.comm: Sp 5.412: Tesaññeva dhammānanti yesu rūpādidhammesu sati kathinaṁ nāma hoti, tesaṁ samodhānaṁ missībhāvo, “‘Of just those things’: the combination and mixing together of those things, such as form, etc., by which there is the name kathina.” Vmv 5.412: Yesu rūpādidhammesūti “purimavassaṁvutthā bhikkhū, pañcahi anūno saṅgho, cīvaramāso, dhammena samena samuppannaṁ cīvara”nti evamādīsu yesu rūpārūpadhammesu, “‘Of those things, such as form, etc.’: monks who have completed the first rains residence, a sangha of no less than five, the robe month, a robe that has arisen legitimately and validly, etc., are those things such as form, etc.”

pli-tv-pvr16:27.1.eng: The month of the robe-making ceremony is to be known:

pli-tv-pvr16:27.2.eng: the last month of the rainy season.

pli-tv-pvr16:28.1.eng: Failure of the robe-making ceremony is to be known:

pli-tv-pvr16:28.2.eng: the robe-making ceremony fails in twenty-four ways.
pli-tv-pvr16:28.2.comm: For the twenty-four, see above and Kd 7:1.5.3–1.5.26.

pli-tv-pvr16:29.1.eng: Success of the robe-making ceremony is to be known:

pli-tv-pvr16:29.2.eng: The robe-making ceremony is successful through seventeen aspects.
pli-tv-pvr16:29.2.comm: For the seventeen, see above and Kd 7:1.6.2.

pli-tv-pvr16:30.1.eng: The giving of an indication is to be known:

pli-tv-pvr16:30.2.pli: nimittaṃ karoti iminā dussena kathinaṃ attharissāmīti.
pli-tv-pvr16:30.2.eng: one makes an indication, thinking, “I’ll perform the robe-making ceremony with this cloth.”

pli-tv-pvr16:31.1.eng: A hint is to be known:

pli-tv-pvr16:31.2.pli: parikathaṃ karoti imāya parikathāya kathinadussaṃ nibbattessāmīti.
pli-tv-pvr16:31.2.eng: one gives a hint, thinking, “With this hint, I’ll make a cloth for the robe-making ceremony appear.”

pli-tv-pvr16:32.2.eng: a gift not to be taken as one’s own.

pli-tv-pvr16:33.2.pli: dve sannidhiyo jānitabbā—karaṇasannidhi vā nicayasannidhi vā.
pli-tv-pvr16:33.2.eng: there are two kinds of storing: for the purpose of making and for the purpose of accumulation.

pli-tv-pvr16:34.2.eng: dawn arrives while it is being made.

pli-tv-pvr16:35.1.eng: Participation in the robe-making ceremony is to be known:

pli-tv-pvr16:35.2.pli: sace saṅghassa kathinadussaṃ uppannaṃ hoti, saṅghena kathaṃ paṭipajjitabbaṃ, atthārakena kathaṃ paṭipajjitabbaṃ, anumodakena kathaṃ paṭipajjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr16:35.2.eng: If cloth has been given to the Sangha for the robe-making ceremony, how should the Sangha proceed? How should the one who performs the robe-making ceremony proceed? How should one who expresses their appreciation proceed?

pli-tv-pvr16:36.1.pli: Saṅghena ñattidutiyena kammena kathinatthārakassa bhikkhuno dātabbaṃ, tena kathinatthārakena bhikkhunā tadaheva dhovitvā vimajjitvā vicāretvā chinditvā sibbetvā rajitvā kappaṃ katvā kathinaṃ attharitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr16:36.1.eng: The Sangha should give the cloth, through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement, to the monk who is performing the robe-making ceremony. The monk who is performing the robe-making ceremony should wash the cloth, iron it, plan it, cut it, sew it, dye it, mark it, and then perform the robe-making ceremony.

pli-tv-pvr16:36.2.pli: Sace saṅghāṭiyā kathinaṃ attharitukāmo hoti, porāṇikā saṅghāṭi paccuddharitabbā, navā saṅghāṭi adhiṭṭhātabbā.
pli-tv-pvr16:36.2.eng: If he wishes to perform the robe-making ceremony with an outer robe, he should relinquish his old outer robe and then determine the new one.

pli-tv-pvr16:36.3.pli: Imāya saṅghāṭiyā kathinaṃ attharāmīti vācā bhinditabbā.
pli-tv-pvr16:36.3.eng: He should then say, “I perform the robe-making ceremony with this outer robe.”

pli-tv-pvr16:36.4.pli: Sace uttarāsaṅgena kathinaṃ attharitukāmo hoti, porāṇako uttarāsaṅgo paccuddharitabbo, navo uttarāsaṅgo adhiṭṭhātabbo.
pli-tv-pvr16:36.4.eng: If he wishes to perform the robe-making ceremony with an upper robe, he should relinquish his old upper robe and then determine the new one.

pli-tv-pvr16:36.5.pli: Iminā uttarāsaṅgena kathinaṃ attharāmīti vācā bhinditabbā.
pli-tv-pvr16:36.5.eng: He should then say, “I perform the robe-making ceremony with this upper robe.”

pli-tv-pvr16:36.6.pli: Sace antaravāsakena kathinaṃ attharitukāmo hoti, porāṇako antaravāsako paccuddharitabbo, navo antaravāsako adhiṭṭhātabbo.
pli-tv-pvr16:36.6.eng: If he wishes to perform the robe-making ceremony with a sarong, he should relinquish his old sarong and then determine the new one.

pli-tv-pvr16:36.7.pli: Iminā antaravāsakena kathinaṃ attharāmīti vācā bhinditabbā.
pli-tv-pvr16:36.7.eng: He should then say, “I perform the robe-making ceremony with this sarong.”

pli-tv-pvr16:36.8.pli: Tena kathinatthārakena bhikkhunā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-pvr16:36.8.eng: After approaching the Sangha, that monk who is performing the robe-making ceremony should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, raise his joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-pvr16:36.9.pli: “atthataṃ, bhante, saṅghassa kathinaṃ, dhammiko kathinatthāro, anumodathā”ti.
pli-tv-pvr16:36.9.eng: “Venerable sirs, the Sangha’s robe-making ceremony has been performed. The robe-making ceremony is legitimate. Please express your appreciation.”

pli-tv-pvr16:36.10.pli: Tehi anumodakehi bhikkhūhi ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-pvr16:36.10.eng: The monks who are expressing their appreciation should arrange their upper robes over one shoulder, raise their joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-pvr16:36.11.pli: “atthataṃ, āvuso, saṅghassa kathinaṃ, dhammiko kathinatthāro, anumodāmā”ti.
pli-tv-pvr16:36.11.eng: “The Sangha’s robe-making ceremony has been performed. The robe-making ceremony is legitimate. We express our appreciation.”

pli-tv-pvr16:36.12.pli: Tena kathinatthārakena bhikkhunā sambahule bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassu vacanīyā—
pli-tv-pvr16:36.12.eng: Or: after approaching several monks, that monk who is performing the robe-making ceremony should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, raise his joined palms, and say:
pli-tv-pvr16:36.12.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “several” for sambahula, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-pvr16:36.13.pli: “atthataṃ, bhante, saṅghassa kathinaṃ, dhammiko kathinatthāro, anumodathā”ti.
pli-tv-pvr16:36.13.eng: “Venerable sirs, the Sangha’s robe-making ceremony has been performed. The robe-making ceremony is legitimate. Please express your appreciation.”

pli-tv-pvr16:36.14.pli: Tehi anumodakehi bhikkhūhi ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-pvr16:36.14.eng: The monks who are expressing their appreciation should arrange their upper robes over one shoulder, raise their joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-pvr16:36.15.pli: “atthataṃ, āvuso, saṅghassa kathinaṃ, dhammiko kathinatthāro anumodāmā”ti.
pli-tv-pvr16:36.15.eng: “The Sangha’s robe-making ceremony has been performed. The robe-making ceremony is legitimate. We express our appreciation.”

pli-tv-pvr16:36.16.pli: Tena kathinatthārakena bhikkhunā ekaṃ bhikkhuṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-pvr16:36.16.eng: Or: after approaching a single monk, that monk who is performing the robe-making ceremony should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, raise his joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-pvr16:36.17.pli: “atthataṃ, āvuso, saṅghassa kathinaṃ, dhammiko kathinatthāro, anumodāhī”ti.
pli-tv-pvr16:36.17.eng: “The Sangha’s robe-making ceremony has been performed. The robe-making ceremony is legitimate. Please express your appreciation.”

pli-tv-pvr16:36.18.pli: Tena anumodakena bhikkhunā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-pvr16:36.18.eng: The monk who is expressing his appreciation should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, raise his joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-pvr16:36.19.pli: “atthataṃ, āvuso, saṅghassa kathinaṃ, dhammiko kathinatthāro, anumodāmī”ti.
pli-tv-pvr16:36.19.eng: “The Sangha’s robe-making ceremony has been performed. The robe-making ceremony is legitimate. I express my appreciation.”

pli-tv-pvr16:37.0.eng: 5. The robe-making ceremony for an individual

pli-tv-pvr16:37.1.pli: Saṅgho kathinaṃ attharati, gaṇo kathinaṃ attharati, puggalo kathinaṃ attharatīti?
pli-tv-pvr16:37.1.eng: “Does the Sangha perform the robe-making ceremony? Does a group perform the robe-making ceremony? Does an individual perform the robe-making ceremony?”

pli-tv-pvr16:37.2.pli: Na saṅgho kathinaṃ attharati, na gaṇo kathinaṃ attharati, puggalo kathinaṃ attharatīti.
pli-tv-pvr16:37.2.eng: “The Sangha does not perform the robe-making ceremony, nor does a group, but an individual does.”

pli-tv-pvr16:37.3.pli: Hañci na saṅgho kathinaṃ attharati, na gaṇo kathinaṃ attharati, puggalo kathinaṃ attharati.
pli-tv-pvr16:37.3.eng: If the Sangha does not perform the robe-making ceremony, nor a group, but an individual does, then

pli-tv-pvr16:37.4.pli: Saṅghassa anatthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, gaṇassa anatthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, puggalassa atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr16:37.4.eng: the Sangha has not performed the robe-making ceremony, nor has a group, but an individual has.

pli-tv-pvr16:37.5.pli: Saṅgho pātimokkhaṃ uddisati gaṇo pātimokkhaṃ uddisati puggalo pātimokkhaṃ uddisatīti?
pli-tv-pvr16:37.5.eng: “Does the Sangha recite the Monastic Code? Does a group recite the Monastic Code? Does an individual recite the Monastic Code?”

pli-tv-pvr16:37.6.pli: Na saṅgho pātimokkhaṃ uddisati, na gaṇo pātimokkhaṃ uddisati, puggalo pātimokkhaṃ uddisatīti.
pli-tv-pvr16:37.6.eng: “The Sangha does not recite the Monastic Code, nor does a group, but an individual does.”

pli-tv-pvr16:37.7.pli: Hañci na saṅgho pātimokkhaṃ uddisati, na gaṇo pātimokkhaṃ uddisati, puggalo pātimokkhaṃ uddisati.
pli-tv-pvr16:37.7.eng: If the Sangha does not recite the Monastic Code, nor a group, but an individual does, then

pli-tv-pvr16:37.8.pli: Saṅghassa anuddiṭṭhaṃ hoti pātimokkhaṃ, gaṇassa anuddiṭṭhaṃ hoti pātimokkhaṃ, puggalassa uddiṭṭhaṃ hoti pātimokkhaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr16:37.8.eng: the Sangha has not recited the Monastic Code, nor has a group, but an individual has.

pli-tv-pvr16:37.9.pli: Saṅghassa sāmaggiyā gaṇassa sāmaggiyā puggalassa uddesā saṅghassa uddiṭṭhaṃ hoti pātimokkhaṃ, gaṇassa uddiṭṭhaṃ hoti pātimokkhaṃ, puggalassa uddiṭṭhaṃ hoti pātimokkhaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr16:37.9.eng: “Yet when an individual recites to unite the Sangha, to unite the group, then the Monastic Code has been recited by the Sangha, by the group, and by the individual.

pli-tv-pvr16:37.10.pli: Evameva na saṅgho kathinaṃ attharati, na gaṇo kathinaṃ attharati, puggalo kathinaṃ attharati.
pli-tv-pvr16:37.10.eng: It is in this way that the Sangha does not perform the robe-making ceremony, nor does a group, but an individual does.

pli-tv-pvr16:37.11.pli: Saṅghassa anumodanāya gaṇassa anumodanāya puggalassa atthārā saṅghassa atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, gaṇassa atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, puggalassa atthataṃ hoti kathinanti.
pli-tv-pvr16:37.11.eng: Yet when an individual performs the robe-making ceremony, and the Sangha expresses its appreciation, the group expresses its appreciation, then the robe-making ceremony has been performed by the Sangha, by the group, and by the individual.”

pli-tv-pvr16:38.0.eng: 6. Questions and answers regarding the obstacles

pli-tv-pvr16:38.1.eng: “The robe season ends when one departs from the monastery.

pli-tv-pvr16:38.2.eng: So said the Kinsman of the Sun.

pli-tv-pvr16:38.3.eng: And about this I ask you:

pli-tv-pvr16:39.1.eng: The robe season ends when one departs from the monastery.

pli-tv-pvr16:39.2.eng: So said the Kinsman of the Sun.

pli-tv-pvr16:39.3.eng: And about this I answer you:

pli-tv-pvr16:39.4.eng: The robe obstacle is removed first.

pli-tv-pvr16:39.5.eng: The monastery obstacle is removed when one goes outside the monastery zone.

pli-tv-pvr16:40.1.eng: The robe season ends when the robe is finished.

pli-tv-pvr16:40.2.eng: So said the Kinsman of the Sun.

pli-tv-pvr16:40.3.eng: And about this I ask you:

pli-tv-pvr16:41.1.eng: The robe season ends when the robe is finished.

pli-tv-pvr16:41.2.eng: So said the Kinsman of the Sun.

pli-tv-pvr16:41.3.eng: And about this I answer you:

pli-tv-pvr16:41.4.eng: The monastery obstacle is removed first.

pli-tv-pvr16:41.5.eng: The robe obstacle is removed when the robe is finished.

pli-tv-pvr16:42.1.eng: The robe season ends when he makes that decision.

pli-tv-pvr16:42.2.eng: So said the Kinsman of the Sun.

pli-tv-pvr16:42.3.eng: And about this I ask you:

pli-tv-pvr16:43.1.eng: The robe season ends when he makes that decision.

pli-tv-pvr16:43.2.eng: So said the Kinsman of the Sun.

pli-tv-pvr16:43.3.eng: And about this I answer you:

pli-tv-pvr16:43.4.eng: The two obstacles are removed simultaneously.

pli-tv-pvr16:44.1.eng: The robe season ends when the robe-cloth is lost.

pli-tv-pvr16:44.2.eng: So said the Kinsman of the Sun.

pli-tv-pvr16:44.3.eng: And about this I ask you:

pli-tv-pvr16:45.1.eng: The robe season ends when the robe-cloth is lost.

pli-tv-pvr16:45.2.eng: So said the Kinsman of the Sun.

pli-tv-pvr16:45.3.eng: And about this I answer you:

pli-tv-pvr16:45.4.eng: The monastery obstacle is removed first.

pli-tv-pvr16:45.5.eng: The robe obstacle is removed when the robe-cloth is lost.

pli-tv-pvr16:46.1.eng: The robe season ends when he hears about the end of the robe season.

pli-tv-pvr16:46.2.eng: So said the Kinsman of the Sun.

pli-tv-pvr16:46.3.eng: And about this I ask you:

pli-tv-pvr16:47.1.eng: The robe season ends when he hears about the end of the robe season.

pli-tv-pvr16:47.2.eng: So said the Kinsman of the Sun.

pli-tv-pvr16:47.3.eng: And about this I answer you:

pli-tv-pvr16:47.4.eng: The robe obstacle is removed first.

pli-tv-pvr16:47.5.eng: The monastery obstacle is removed when one hears about the end of the robe season.

pli-tv-pvr16:48.1.eng: The robe season ends when the expectation is disappointed.

pli-tv-pvr16:48.2.eng: So said the Kinsman of the Sun.

pli-tv-pvr16:48.3.eng: And about this I ask you:

pli-tv-pvr16:49.1.eng: The robe season ends when the expectation is disappointed.

pli-tv-pvr16:49.2.eng: So said the Kinsman of the Sun.

pli-tv-pvr16:49.3.eng: And about this I answer you:

pli-tv-pvr16:49.4.eng: The monastery obstacle is removed first.

pli-tv-pvr16:49.5.eng: The robe obstacle is removed when the expectation of more robe-cloth is disappointed.

pli-tv-pvr16:50.1.eng: The robe season ends while he is outside the monastery zone.

pli-tv-pvr16:50.2.eng: So said the Kinsman of the Sun.

pli-tv-pvr16:50.3.eng: And about this I ask you:

pli-tv-pvr16:51.1.eng: The robe season ends while he is outside the monastery zone.

pli-tv-pvr16:51.2.eng: So said the Kinsman of the Sun.

pli-tv-pvr16:51.3.eng: And about this I answer you:

pli-tv-pvr16:51.4.eng: The robe obstacle is removed first.

pli-tv-pvr16:51.5.eng: The monastery obstacle is removed when one is outside the monastery zone.

pli-tv-pvr16:52.2.eng: So said the Kinsman of the Sun.

pli-tv-pvr16:52.3.eng: And about this I ask you:

pli-tv-pvr16:53.2.eng: So said the Kinsman of the Sun.

pli-tv-pvr16:53.3.eng: And about this I answer you:

pli-tv-pvr16:53.4.eng: The two obstacles are removed simultaneously.”

pli-tv-pvr16:54.1.eng: “How many kinds of endings of the robe season depend on the Sangha?

pli-tv-pvr16:54.2.eng: How many kinds of endings of the robe season depend on an individual?

pli-tv-pvr16:54.3.pli: Kati kathinuddhārā neva saṅghādhīnā na puggalādhīnā?
pli-tv-pvr16:54.3.eng: How many kinds of endings of the robe season depend neither on the Sangha nor on an individual?

pli-tv-pvr16:54.4.eng: One kind of ending of the robe season depends on the Sangha:

pli-tv-pvr16:54.5.eng: when the robe season ends midway.
pli-tv-pvr16:54.5.comm: According to Sp 1.462, this refers to the legal procedure done by the Sangha to end the robe season before its natural end, for which see Bi Pc 30:1.1.10.

pli-tv-pvr16:54.6.eng: Four kinds of endings of the robe season depend on an individual:

pli-tv-pvr16:54.7.eng: when one departs from the monastery, when the robe is finished, when one makes a decision, and when one is outside the monastery zone.

pli-tv-pvr16:54.8.pli: Cattāro kathinuddhārā neva saṅghādhīnā na puggalādhīnā—
pli-tv-pvr16:54.8.eng: Four kinds of endings of the robe season depend neither on the Sangha nor on an individual:

pli-tv-pvr16:54.9.eng: when the robe-cloth is lost, when one hears about the end of the robe season, when an expectation of more robe-cloth is disappointed, and when the robe season ends together.

pli-tv-pvr16:54.10.eng: How many kinds of endings of the robe season happen inside the monastery zone?

pli-tv-pvr16:54.11.eng: How many kinds of endings of the robe season happen outside the monastery zone?

pli-tv-pvr16:54.12.pli: Kati kathinuddhārā siyā antosīmāya uddhariyyanti siyā bahisīmāya uddhariyyanti?
pli-tv-pvr16:54.12.eng: How many kinds of endings of the robe season may happen either inside or outside the monastery zone?

pli-tv-pvr16:54.13.eng: Two kinds of endings of the robe season happen inside the monastery zone:

pli-tv-pvr16:54.14.eng: when the robe season ends midway, and when the robe season ends together.

pli-tv-pvr16:54.15.eng: Three kinds of endings of the robe season happen outside the monastery zone:

pli-tv-pvr16:54.16.eng: when one departs from the monastery, when one hears about the end of the robe season, and when one is outside the monastery zone.

pli-tv-pvr16:54.17.pli: Cattāro kathinuddhārā siyā antosīmāya uddhariyyanti siyā bahisīmāya uddhariyyanti—
pli-tv-pvr16:54.17.eng: Four kinds of endings of the robe season may happen inside or outside the monastery zone:

pli-tv-pvr16:54.18.eng: when the robe is finished, when one makes a decision, when the robe-cloth is lost, and when an expectation of more robe-cloth is disappointed.

pli-tv-pvr16:55.1.eng: How many kinds of endings of the robe season arise together and end together?

pli-tv-pvr16:55.2.eng: How many kinds of endings of the robe season arise together and end separately?

pli-tv-pvr16:55.3.eng: Two kinds of endings of the robe season arise together and end together:

pli-tv-pvr16:55.4.eng: when the robe season ends midway, and when the robe season ends together.

pli-tv-pvr16:55.5.eng: The rest of the endings of the robe season arise together but end separately.”
